intro: Urena trilobata, commonly known as the three-lobed urena, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant that typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has alternate, ovate leaves with three distinct lobes, giving it its common name. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, arranged in clusters, and produce small, hairy fruits. Urena trilobata is often found in disturbed soils and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
